newsitem.title: EU: EC REPORT WEEKLY DIARY FOR MONDAY, SEPT 30 - SUNDAY, OCT 6.
newsitem.headline: EC REPORT WEEKLY DIARY FOR MONDAY, SEPT 30 - SUNDAY, OCT 6.

text.p: HIGHLIGHTS

BRUSSELS - IGC Working Party of EU foreign ministers' representatives meets to continue review of EU treaties (Monday); discussion on the follow-up to specific issues in the light of first round of discussions.

LUXEMBOURG - EU foreign ministers meet (Tuesday); main discussion focuses on the extraterritorial effects of the Helms Burton/D'Amato legislation and situation in the Middle-East; followed by sixth inter-governmental conference ministerial meeting.

TOKYO - European Commission President Jacques Santer, Irish Prime Minister and European Council President John Bruton meet Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto for annual summit (Tuesday-Friday); preparation for WTO ministerial meeting in Singapore and general EU/U.S./Japan trade issues.
DUBLIN - German Chancellor Helmut Kohl on official visit (Wednesday-Thursday) ahead of Saturday's special EU summit.
BRUSSELS - European Commission holds regular weekly meeting (Wednesday); presentation of Council regulation on a list of textile and clothing products to be integrated into the GATT.

PARIS - French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette and German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel meet ahead of Saturday's special European Council in Dublin to discuss Franco-German position on inter-governmental conference (Wednesday).
LUXEMBOURG - Transport Council (and Friday); joint meeting of the Council with central and eastern European countries' ministers.
DUBLIN - European Union leaders hold special summit (Saturday); discussion on a wide range of issues including trade, drugs and the EU's future.
MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 30

DUBLIN - European Commission and Irish Presidency of the EU host colloquium on "People first - Challenges of living and working in the European information society" (0800/0700 GMT) (and Tuesday). Main discussions focus on employment and economic structure in the information society; future of work in the information society; labour market and learning in the information society and living in the information society. Speakers include: Irish Labour Minister Eithne Fitzgerald; European Commissioner Flynn. Venue: Dublin Castle. Contact: People first secretariat (353) 1 677 7608.

BRUSSELS - IGC Working Party of EU foreign ministers' representatives meets to continue review of EU treaties. Topics include: flexibility, follow-up to specific issues in the light of first round of discussions.
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Following EP committees meet:
(1500/1300 GMT) Energy;
Transport;
Women's Rights.

VIENNA (NEW ITEM) - Economic and Social Committee President Carlos Ferrer on official visit; meets Austrian Economics Minister Johann Farnleitner (1100/0900 GMT) and Chancellor Franz Vranitzky (1600/1400 GMT). ***
TUESDAY, OCTOBER 1
LUXEMBOURG (EXPANDED ITEM) - General Affairs Council (0930/0730 GMT).
Agenda includes:
- Preparation for December 9-13 WTO ministerial conference in Singapore.

- EU/U.S. relations - extraterritorial effects of the Helms Burton/D'Amato legislation. The main element for the retaliatory action by the EU consists in establishing legal instruments to protect EU economic operators and related persons against the effects of the application of the Helms/Burton and d'Amato legislation.

- KEDO (Korean Peninsular Energy Development Organisation). The Council is expected to adopt the mandate authorising the Commission to negotiate an agreement for accession by EURATOM to KEDO. The main objective of KEDO is to secure the peaceful use of nuclear energy in the Korean peninsula.
- Mediterranean policy: negotiations with Jordan and Egypt:

- Jordan: Commission information on the progress made in the negotiations with Jordan on a Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement. The Council is called upon to resolve two main issues: certain social questions and agricultural concessions. The presidency has put forward a compromise proposal in this regard which is submitted fro political appreciation by ministers.

- Egypt: Commission statement on prospects for the negotiation of a Euro-Mediterranean Association Agreement with Egypt. The Council could raise the question of a date for the a Cooperation Council with Egypt under the current agreement in order to pursue the dialogue.
- Situation in former Yugoslavia:

In the presence of High Representative Carl Bildt and EU Special Envoy for Mostar Sir Martin Garrod, the Council will have a full discussion on the situation in former Yugoslavia covering the follow-up to the Bosnian elections, the general perspective of the peace process, the medium and long-term strategy of the EU. Possible discussions on the situation in Kosovo, the work of the International Criminal Tribunal, arms control, the implementation of reconstruction programmes, the return of refugees and the development of the European Union's approach for its relations with countries of the area.

- Situation and relations with the middle east in light of the recent events and the contacts they have had on this subject with third countries, particularly on the occasion of the current session of the U.N. General Assembly.
- EU government representatives conference on the choice of the Community's Plant Variety Office seat.

- (1530/1330 GMT) Exchange of views with EP President Klaus Haensch, MEPs Elmar Brok and Elisabeth Guigou followed by sixth inter-governmental conference (IGC) ministerial meeting which will focus on employment and justice and home affairs.
TOKYO - European Commission President Jacques Santer, Irish Prime Minister and European Council President John Bruton meet Japanese Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto for the annual summit (to Friday).
Provisional agenda includes:
- Political dialogue:
- EU/Japan cooperation in former Yugoslavia;
- State of Korean relations;
- Situation in the Middle East.
- Trade and investment:
- Preparation for WTO ministerial meeting in Singapore;
- Bilateral discussions on the Japanese deregulation programme.
- Cooperation and development:
- Japanese humanitarian aid to under-developed countries.
- General discussion on the situation in Asia and follow-up to ASEM summit held in Bangkok.
- General discussion on EU/Japan/U.S. relations.
European Commissioner Santer also meets Japanese Emperor Akihito and business chiefs and academics.

BRUSSELS - European Parliament, Regions and Local authorities hold joint conference designed to improve their relations and to discuss how to strenghten democracy and solidarity in the EU (to Thursday). Contact: EP fax (352) 4300 2673.

BRUSSELS - Centre for European Policy Studies (CEPS) holds lunchtime seminar on "Priorities for the EU's agriculture" (1315/1115 GMT). Speaker is: European Commissioner Fischler. Venue: place du Congres 1. Contact: Anne-Marie Boudou (322) 229 3911.

BRUSSELS - Touchstone exhibitions and conferences hold conference on "Managing economic transition in central and eastern Europe and central Asia" (to Thursday). Venue: Palais des Congres. Contact: Olga Arola, Touchstone exhibitions and conferences (44) 181 332 0044.
BRUSSELS - Agra Europe holds conference on "CAP reform 1996-2000 and beyond" (and Wednesday). Venue: Sheraton Hotel. Contact: Agra Europe (44) 1892 511 807.
WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 2
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - European Commission holds regular weekly meeting (0930/0730 GMT).
Provisional agenda includes:
- State aids including formal decision on Portuguese public television.
- European Commissioners Cresson, Flynn and Monti present communication on mobile trans-national barriers.
- Action plan on learning in the information society.
- European Commissioner van den Broek presents communication on relations with south eastern European countries.
- European Commissioners Brittan and Bangemann present communication on Council regulation on a list of textile and clothing products to be integrated into the GATT.
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Following EP committees meet:
(0900/0700 GMT) Energy;
Legal Affairs;
Transport;
Women's Rights;
(1500/1300 GMT) Foreign Affairs;
Agriculture;
Budget.

PARIS - French Foreign Minister Herve de Charette and German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel meet ahead of Saturday's special European Council in Dublin to discuss Franco-German position on inter-governmental conference.
DUBLIN (NEW ITEM) - German Chancellor Helmut Kohl on official visit (and Thursday) ahead of Saturday's special EU summit.
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Agra Europe holds conference on "CAP reform 1996-2000 and beyond" (0900/0700 GMT) (and Thursday). Venue: Sheraton Hotel. Contact: Agra Europe (44) 1892 511807.

BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - European Environmental Bureau (EEB) holds news conference on "Towards a European governance scheme and the conclusions of EEB meetings with the Irish presidency" (1030/0830 GMT). Venue: International Press Centre (IPC). Contact: EEB (322) 539 0037.

BRUSSELS - Union of Industrial and Employers Confederation of Europe (UNICE) hold news conference on "Inter-governmental conference (IGC) - viewpoint of European companies" (0815/0615 GMT). Venue: Dorint Hotel. Contact: UNICE, Christophe de Callatay (322) 237 6515.
BRUSSELS - European Aluminium Association holds annual international conference (1045/0845 GMT). Venue: Hotel Renaissance. Contact: Strategic Communications (322) 387 2191.

BRUSSELS - European Trade Union Confederation (ETUC) holds conference on "European Works Councils and the Europeanisations of industrial relations" (1330/1130 GMT) (To October 4). Main topics discussed: European Works Council, an incitement social dialogue; the EP and the directive; voluntary agreements: developments from 1995 to 1996; specific aspects and experiences of existing agreements; advisory needs and training for European Works Councils; the transposition of the directive: the present situation; strategies at sectorial level for application of the directive; EWC: a non-European point of view; role of EWC-Europeanisation of industrial relations. Venue: ITUH, Auditorium 155 Blvd Emile Jacqmain. Contact: ETUC (322) 224 0411.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 3
LUXEMBOURG (EXPANDED ITEM) - Transport Council (0930/0730 GMT) (and Friday).
Agenda includes:
- External Relations:

- Recommendation for a Council decision authorising the Commission to open negotiations on air transport agreements between the Community and Bulgaria, the Czech Republic, Hungary, Poland, Romania and Slovakia.
- Preparation for joint meeting of the Council with central and eastern European countries' ministers.
- Commission report on the follow-up of negotiatioons between the EU and Swizterland in ground and air transport.
- Ground transport:
- Proposal for directive on lorry tax for the use of certain infrastructures - debate.
- Proposal for a Council regulation laying down the conditions under which non-resident carriers may operate national road passengers transport services within a member state.
- Rail transport:
- White paper on the future of the railways.
- Air transport:
- Proposal for a Council regulation on air carrier liabilities in case of accidents COM(95)724 - debate.
- Maritime transport:
- Proposal for a Council directive setting up a harmonised safety regime for fishing vessels of 24 metres or more in length.
BRUSSELS (NEW ITEM) - Following EP committees meet:
(0900/0700 GMT) Foreign Affairs;
Agriculture;
Budget.

BRUSSELS - European Centre for Advanced Research in Economics (ECARE) holds lunchtime seminar on "Competition policy in central Europe: facilitating transition and preparing for EU integration" (1330/1130 GMT). Venue: ECARE, 39 avenue Franklin Roosevelt. Contact: Nancy De Munck (322) 650 3075.

LIEGE, Belgium - European Institute for Legal Studies "Fernand Dehousse" holds conference on "Regional trade agreements and multilateral rules after the Uruguay Round: convergence, divergence and interaction" (to Saturday). Venue: Palais des Congres. Contact: Xavier Denoel, Liege University (32) 41 66 3156.
FRIDAY, OCTOBER 4
No events scheduled.
SATURDAY, OCTOBER 5

DUBLIN - European Union leaders hold special summit to discuss a wide range of issues including trade, drugs and the EU's future (1400/1300 GMT). Agenda likely to include the IGC, employment and social protection, the fight against drugs, and preparations for the December ministerial meeting of the World Trade Organisation in Singapore.
SUNDAY, OCTOBER 6
No events scheduled.
If you have items for inclusion in the Reuter European
Community diary, please contact:
Telephone: Cynthia Simpson (322) 287 6851
For technical queries regarding
the service, please call (322) 287 6666
Reuters 61, rue de Treves 1040 BRUSSELS
